title: Chef Christina Tosi, Director Anthony Russo Speak at Future of Everything Festival; CEOs of UnitedHealth Group, Oishii and Zus Health, as well as actress Rosie Perez, also are guests on final day of event
text:
The Future of Everything Festival is happening right now. Click here to register and watch for free as a member.

Executives and innovators from healthcare, entertainment, food, tech and finance will discuss Covid-19, sustainable living and the future of storytelling on the final day of The Wall Street Journal Future of Everything Festival.

The healthcare discussion kicks off with Zus Health CEO Jonathan Bush explaining the factors driving booming investments in healthcare technology (10:30 a.m. ET).Moderna Chief Executive Stéphane Bancel (10:35 a.m.) will weigh in on vaccines' effectiveness against new Covid-19 variants and how important vaccine access is to eradicating the virus. UnitedHealth Group CEO Andrew Witty resumes the conversation on healthcare equity in the afternoon, discussing the innovation required by providers to create a fairer system (12:45 p.m.).

Amid pressures on the supply chain, Oishii CEO Hiroki Koga, whose company operates the world's largest indoor vertical strawberry farm, discusses new technologies, sustainable farming methods and his predictions for consumer demand for luxury food products (10 a.m.).

Chef Christina Tosi, CEO of Milk Bar, takes the stage to discuss how the pandemic has reshaped dining and the latest in baking and dessert trends (10:10 a.m.).

Exploring smart homes and the future of tech in our daily lives, Amazon.com's David Limp—whose team has developed devices including Alexa, Fire Tablets, and the new home robot Astro—joins The Wall Street Journal's Joanna Stern (11 a.m.) to talk about the next frontier for computing. Later in the day (12:40 p.m.), Rendever CEO Kyle Rand talks about how technology can change the lives of residents in senior-living communities.

Architect and inventor Neri Oxman (12:15 p.m.) shares her vision for cities of the future, combining design, technology and biology to create products and buildings to help combat climate change.

Entertainment takes center stage as actress Rosie Perez unpacks her role in the HBO Max thriller series "The Flight Attendant" (12:10 p.m.). Conor McPherson and Simon Hale, the driving forces behind Tony-nominated musical "Girl From the North Country," talk about the future of Broadway, with a special performance from cast members Colin Bates and Caitlin Houlahan (1:05 p.m.). And Anthony Russo, who along with his brother Joe steered several blockbuster movies from the Marvel Cinematic Universe, talks about the formation and investment in their new studio, AGBO, and new models of storytelling (1:15 p.m.).

Chef Christina Tosi, Director Anthony Russo Speak at Future of Everything Festival
